ygData.subject: Re: New character and Wisdom
ygData.msgSnippet: I understand that when hitting level 9 I will have to put a point towards the magic skills.  What I was wondering is if I will have enough mana to be able to
ygData.messageBody:
I understand that when hitting level 9 I will have to put a point towards
the magic skills. What I was wondering is if I will have enough mana to be
able to cast all the spells at level 9 when I get them. My SK didn't have
enough mana to be able to cast 2 of his spells and I would hate to get to
level 9 and have the samething happen with this guy. But as Tyler said,
he's a level 13 Human Paladin with 85 Wisdom and he has enough mana. So I
think my Dwarf Paladin with 90 Wisdom should be ok. I have just heard
reports that some Paladins didn't have enough mana to cast cure poison when
they first got it and I wanted to make sure that my guy would be able to.

-Kalamar(E'ci)

-----Original Message-----
From: Guillaume Voizard <gvoizard@...>
To: eqpaladin@onelist.com <eqpaladin@onelist.com>
Date: Wednesday, April 28, 1999 11:27 AM
Subject: [eqpaladin] Re: New character and Wisdom


>From: Guillaume Voizard <gvoizard@...>
>
>These is what I noticed.
>If you have an ability (not only on spells) from level 1, it can increase
by
>itself. When you have a new ability, you must spend at least one practice
>point to learn it. And your guildmaster says "You have learnt the basics
>of...". It seems that you then have a base that equals to your level. THEN
>it can increase by itself. But it sometimes depends of the ability. For
>example, some people think that Safe Fall for the monk never increases
>except with practive points.
>
>Erwin, Paladin of Tunare
>Fennin Ro
>
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: Rodney Miller [mailto:RMiller@...]
>Sent: Wednesday, April 28, 1999 8:22 AM
>To: 'eqpaladin@onelist.com'
>Subject: [eqpaladin] Re: New character and Wisdom
>
>
>From: Rodney Miller <RMiller@...>
>
>One thing that I have noticed, (correct me if I am wrong), is that if I
>haven't practiced at least one time with my Guildmaster on a type of spell
>(abjuration for instance) my experience does not increase in that spell
type
>until I do. So it may seem that you can't use a spell or that it is not
>working well, but you need to practice it with the Guildmaster at least
once
>to kind of "kick start" the spell. This is the way it has worked for me.
>If anyone has any more information on practicing and spells, let me know.
I
>am just about to go to level 11 and will be curious as to where to utilize
>my practices.
>
>Grod
>10th Level Paladin (almost 11)
>Innoruuk Server
>
>
